message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and laboratory results suggest that she may have neuroleptic malignant syndrome (NMS), a severe reaction to antipsychotic medication. The first step in management should be to stop the causative medication, in this case, risperidone. Intravenous hydration may be important for subsequent management, but stopping the medication is the priority to prevent further complications. Paracetamol and switching to clozapine are not appropriate management options for NMS.
